Name: Lets Encrypt - Self-Hosted HTTP Challenge
Description:
Request (or renew) an X.509 SSL Certificate from the [Let's Encrypt Certificate Authority](https://letsencrypt.org/) using the Self-hosted HTTP Challenge Listener provided by the [Posh-ACME](https://github.com/rmbolger/Posh-ACME/) PowerShell Module.

---
#### Please Note

It's generally a better idea to use one of the Posh-ACME [DNS providers](https://github.com/rmbolger/Posh-ACME/wiki/List-of-Supported-DNS-Providers) for Let's Encrypt.

There are a number of Octopus Step templates in the [Community Library](https://library.octopus.com/listing/letsencrypt) that support DNS providers.

---

#### Features

- ACME v2 protocol support which allows generating wildcard certificates (*.example.com).
- [Self-hosted HTTP Challenge](https://github.com/rmbolger/Posh-ACME/wiki/How-To-Self-Host-HTTP-Challenges) Challenge for TLD, CNAME, and Wildcard domains. 
- _Optionally_ Publishes/Updates SSL Certificates in the [Octopus Deploy Certificate Store](https://octopus.com/docs/deployment-examples/certificates).
- _Optionally_ import SSL Certificate into the local machine store. 
- _Optionally_ Export PFX (PKCS#12) SSL Certificate to a supplied file path.
- Verified to work on Windows and Linux deployment targets

#### Pre-requisites

- There are specific requirements when [running on Windows](https://github.com/rmbolger/Posh-ACME/wiki/How-To-Self-Host-HTTP-Challenges#windows-only-prerequisites).
- HTTP Challenge Listener must be available on Port 80.
- When updating the Octopus Certificate Store, access to the Octopus Server from where the script template runs e.g. deployment target or worker is required.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_CertificateDomain
Parameters.Label: Certificate Domain
Parameters.HelpText: Domain (TLD, CNAME, or Wildcard) to create a certificate for.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_ContactEmailAddress
Parameters.Label: Contact Email Address
Parameters.HelpText: The Email address used when requesting the SSL certificate. _Default: `#{Octopus.Deployment.CreatedBy.EmailAddress}`_.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_PfxPass
Parameters.Label: PFX Password
Parameters.HelpText: The password to use when converting to/from PFX.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_Use_Staging
Parameters.Label: Use Lets Encrypt Staging
Parameters.HelpText: Should the Certificate be generated using the Lets Encrypt Staging infrastructure? _Default: `False`_.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_HttpListenerTimeout
Parameters.Label: Http Listener Timeout
Parameters.HelpText: Self-Hosted Http Listener Timeout in Seconds. _Default: 120 seconds_.

Parameters.Name: LE_Self_Hosted_UpdateOctopusCertificateStore
Parameters.Label: Update Octopus Certificate Store?
Parameters.HelpText: Should any generated certificate be updated in the [Octopus Deploy Certificate Store](https://octopus.com/docs/deployment-examples/certificates) _Default: `True`_.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_Octopus_APIKey
Parameters.Label: Octopus Deploy API key
Parameters.HelpText:
An Octopus Deploy API key with access to change Certificates in the Certificate Store. 

**Note:** Required if `LE_Self_Hosted_UpdateOctopusCertificateStore` is set to `True`.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_ReplaceIfExpiresInDays
Parameters.Label: Replace expiring certificate before N days
Parameters.HelpText:
Replace the certificate if it expiries within N days. _Default: 30 days_.

**Note:** Required if `LE_Self_Hosted_UpdateOctopusCertificateStore` is set to `True`.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_Install
Parameters.Label: Install Certificate?
Parameters.HelpText: Installs the certificate in the local store. _Default: `False`_.

Parameters.Name: LE_SelfHosted_ExportFilePath
Parameters.Label: PFX Export Filepath
Parameters.HelpText: Exports the full certificate chain as PKCS#12 archive (.PFX used by Windows and IIS) e.g. C:\Temp\octopus.com.pfx
